panels.description: Percentage of total CPU utilisation.
panels.title: CPU %

panels.description:
- *total*: The amount of actual physical memory.
- *available*: The amount of physical memory currently available.
panels.title: System Memory

panels.description:
- *used*: The amount of used memory.
- *max*: The maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management.
- *init*: The amount of memory that the JVM initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
panels.title: Heap

panels.description: The number of active MQTT connections.
panels.title: Current MQTT Connections

panels.description: The number of nodes in the cluster.
panels.title: Cluster Nodes

panels.description: The amount of data received for each network interface. Measured in bytes per second.
panels.title: incoming Bytes/s

panels.description: The amount of data sent for each network interface. Measured in bytes per second.
panels.title: outgoing Bytes/s

panels.description: The amount of data read for each disk. Measured in bytes per second.
panels.title: Disk Bytes Read/s

panels.description: The amount of data written for each disk. Measured in bytes per second.
panels.title: Disk Bytes Written/s

panels.description: The number of disk I/O tasks in the queue for each persistence executor.
panels.title: Single Writer Tasks/s

panels.description: The number of active MQTT connections.
panels.title: Current MQTT Connections

panels.description: The number of stored sessions. These sessions include all sessions, including online and offline clients.
panels.title: Current MQTT Sessions

panels.description: The number of subscriptions on the broker.
panels.title: Current Subscriptions

panels.description: The number of queued messages.
panels.title: Queued Messages

panels.description: The number of messages dropped for grouped by reason, per second.

panels.description:
- *used*: The amount of used memory.
- *max*: The maximum amount of memory that can be used for memory management.
- *init*: The amount of memory that the JVM initially requests from the operating system for memory management.
panels.title: Heap

panels.description:
- *old-gen*: The number of old generation garbage collections per second.
- *young-gen*: The number of young generation garbage collections per second.
panels.title: GC/s

panels.description:
- *old-gen*: The approximate accumulated elapsed time for old generation garbage collections.
- *young-gen*: The approximate accumulated elapsed time for young generation garbage collections.
panels.title: GC times

panels.description: The number of MQTT to Amazon Kinesis messages that the extension successfully forwards for each mqtt-to-kinesis-route, per second.
